SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io.socket.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.io.socket.client.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public final class Client extends Object implements Runnable
A client application that connects to a server, sends requests, and processes responses.

The Client class implements the Runnable interface, allowing it to run in a separate thread. It handles establishing a connection to the server, sending requests based on user input or scripts, and processing server responses. The client also manages reconnection and cleanup in case of disconnections or errors.

Key Features:

  • Establishes and maintains a connection with the server using SocketChannel.
  • Processes user input via a ConsoleWorker or scripted input via an IOWorker.
  • Sends serialized Request objects to the server and receives serialized Response objects.
  • Handles automatic reconnection attempts in case of connection loss.
  • Gracefully shuts down the client by closing the channel and releasing resources.

Usage:

 ClientConfiguration configuration = new ClientConfiguration("localhost", 8080);
 ConsoleWorker console = new ConsoleWorker();
 IOWorker scriptWorker = new IOWorkerinvalid input: '<'>();

 Client client = new Client(configuration, console, scriptWorker);
 new Thread(client).start();

Thread Safety:

This class is not thread-safe. It assumes a single-threaded context for managing its state and interacting with the server.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(ClientConfiguration configuration, ConsoleWorker console, IOWorker<String> script)
      Constructs a Client instance with the specified configuration and I/O workers.

      This constructor initializes the client with its required dependencies: configuration for server connection details, a console worker for handling user interactions, and a script worker for executing predefined command scripts.

      All parameters are mandatory, and null values are not allowed.

      Parameters:
      configuration - the ClientConfiguration containing server connection details.
      console - the ConsoleWorker for handling user input and output.
      script - the IOWorker for executing command scripts.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null.

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      private void getUser()

    • init

      private void init() throws IOException
      Initializes the client by attempting to connect to the server.

      This method performs the following steps:

      • Retrieves the server address from the configuration.
      • Attempts to establish a connection with the server using a SocketChannel.
      • Retries the connection up to a maximum of 5 attempts with a 2-second delay between attempts if the initial connection fails.
      • Logs connection successes and failures, providing detailed information about each attempt.

      If the connection cannot be established after the maximum number of retries, an IOException is thrown to indicate the failure.

      Throws:
      IOException - if the connection cannot be established after the maximum number of retries.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the client by connecting to the server and processing user commands.

      This method initializes the client, connects to the server, and enters a loop to process commands entered by the user or read from a script. The loop continues until the user terminates the session by entering the exit command.

      Workflow:

      • Initializes the client by connecting to the server using the init() method.
      • Displays a welcome message to the user via the console.
      • Continuously reads user input from the console and processes it using handleInput(String).
      • Processes script commands if a script is being executed, ensuring each line is handled.
      • Handles any I/O or unexpected errors by logging and attempting to reconnect.
      • Performs cleanup by closing the client channel when the session ends.

      Error Handling:

      • Logs and attempts to reconnect on I/O errors.
      • Logs unexpected errors and terminates gracefully.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • handleInput

      private void handleInput(String input) throws IOException
      Handles input commands or script lines by processing and sending them to the server.

      This method parses the input into a Request, sends it to the server, and processes the Response received. If the input is the exit command, it terminates the client session.

      Workflow:

      • Ignores blank or null input lines.
      • Handles the exit command by closing the client channel and exiting the application.
      • Parses the input into a Request object using parseRequest(String).
      • Sends the request to the server using sendRequest(Request).
      • Receives and processes the server's response using receiveResponse() and handleResponse(Response).
      Parameters:
      input - the input command or script line to process.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during communication with the server.

    • sendRequest

      private void sendRequest(Request request) throws IOException
      Sends a serialized request to the server.

      This method serializes the Request object into a byte array, packages it into a ByteBuffer with its length as a 4-byte integer prefix, and writes the buffer to the server's channel.

      Workflow:

      • Serializes the Request into a byte array.
      • Creates a ByteBuffer to hold the length of the data and the serialized data.
      • Writes the buffer to the server's SocketChannel until all bytes are sent.
      Parameters:
      request - the Request object to be sent to the server.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the server channel.

    • receiveResponse

      private Response receiveResponse() throws IOException
      Receives a serialized response from the server and deserializes it into a Response object.

      This method reads the response length as a 4-byte integer, then reads the response data from the server's SocketChannel. It deserializes the data into a Response object using SerializationUtils.

      Workflow:

      • Allocates a buffer to read the 4-byte length of the incoming response.
      • Reads the length and allocates a buffer for the response data.
      • Reads the response data into the buffer and deserializes it into a Response object.
      Returns:
      the deserialized Response object received from the server.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the server channel.

    • readFromChannel

      private void readFromChannel(ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException
      Reads data from the server's channel into the specified buffer.

      This method ensures that the buffer is fully filled by reading from the SocketChannel until all remaining bytes are consumed. If the server closes the connection, an IOException is thrown.

      Workflow:

      • Continuously reads data from the SocketChannel until the buffer is filled.
      • If the server closes the connection during reading, throws an exception.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the ByteBuffer to read data into.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs or the server closes the connection.

    • handleResponse

      private void handleResponse(Response response)
      Handles the received server response by displaying messages, listing persons, or executing scripts.

      This method processes the Response object from the server by:

      • Writing the response message to the console if it is not blank.
      • Listing the persons from the response by printing their toString() representation to the console.
      • Inserting scripts from the response into the IOWorker for execution.
      Parameters:
      response - the Response object received from the server.

    • parseRequest

      private Request parseRequest(String input)
      Parses the input command line into a Request object.

      This method splits the input string into a command and its arguments. It also determines the number of Person objects required for the command and retrieves them either from the console or the IOWorker. If the parsing or input retrieval is interrupted, the method logs a warning and returns null.

      Workflow:

      • Splits the input string into the command and arguments.
      • Determines the required number of Person objects for the command.
      • Attempts to retrieve the required Person objects from input sources.
      • Constructs a Request object with the command, arguments, and persons.
      Parameters:
      input - the input command line entered by the user or read from a script.
      Returns:
      the constructed Request, or null if parsing fails or input retrieval is interrupted.

    • reconnect

      private void reconnect()
      Reconnects the client to the server in case of disconnection.

      This method attempts to reconnect the client by reinitializing the connection using the init() method. If reconnection fails, the application exits with an error message.

      Workflow:

      • Writes a message to the console indicating the reconnection attempt.
      • Attempts to reinitialize the client connection using init().
      • If reconnection fails, writes an error message to the console and exits the application.

    • closeClientChannel

      private void closeClientChannel()
      Safely closes the client channel.

      This method checks if the client channel is open and attempts to close it. Any exceptions encountered during the closing operation are logged as errors.

      Workflow:

      • Checks if the SocketChannel is non-null and open.
      • Closes the channel if it is open.
      • Logs any errors encountered during the closing operation.
